#Text=Viana do Castelo
#Text=Viana do Castelo is one of the most beautiful Portuguese cities , in the Minho region of Northern Portugal .
#Text=The Pilgrimage of Nossa Senhora da Agonia and the amazing views of the Lima River make this city unforgettable .
#Text=Classified as the Mecca of Architecture by Wallpaper , the city is famous for the monuments in and around the city , and the surrounding natural beauty .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The city is the capital of a municipality with 314,36 km ² and has some 36.750 inhabitants .

#Text=The municipality borders the municipality of Caminha in the north , the municipality of Ponte de Lima in the east , the municipalities of Barcelos ans Esposende in the south and the Atlantic Ocean in the west .
#Text=The city 's origins date back to before the Christian era , as it can be seen in the hill fort near the Basilica of Santa Luzia .

#Text=It received its first foral from King Afonso III of Portugal in 1258 , as well as the name Viana da Foz do Lima , because of its geografical location ; in 1848 it became a city by a decree of Maria II of Portugal , and received the name of Viana do Castelo .
#Text=By air
#Text=The closest airport is Sá Carneiro International Airport in Porto , with frequent flights from Lisbon , Madeira , and many principal European cities .
#Text=You can fly to Porto and then catch a transport to the city ( see below ) .
#Text=By train

#Text=The train station of Viana do Castelo is located in this borough , and there is a train to almost every city in the country , such as Lisbon , Aveiro , Braga , Coimbra , Évora , Faro , Fátima , Figueira da Foz , Portimão , Porto , Guimarães and Guarda .
#Text=Viana do Castelo railway station ( Estação Ferroviária de Viana do Castelo ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Some companies , such as AVIC , have connections to Porto and Lisboa .
#Text=By car
#Text=The two main highways through town are :
#Text=A28 - Connects the town to Porto , Matosinhos , Leça da Palmeira , Póvoa de Varzim , Apúlia/ Barcelos , Esposende , Vila Praia de Âncora and Caminha .
#Text=A27 - Connects the town to Ponte de Lima and Ponte da Barca .
#Text=On foot
#Text=The most obvious way to see the town is on foot .
#Text=Most of the city 's attractions and a large part of its shopping are found in the historic downtown , quite close to each other , and many pathways downtown are pedestrian-only .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Although there are few bicycle lanes , the city center is very bike friendly .
#Text=Rentals are available in the Tourist Information Office near Praça da Liberdade .
#Text=During the summer , the 2/4 seats pedal karts are also very popular .
#Text=By bus
#Text=AVIC and Transcunha city buses ply the streets .
#Text=By car
#Text=Traffic is light , and roads are clearly marked .
#Text=Car rentals
#Text=Avis Rent-a-Car , Rua de Gotim 35 , tel . +351 258 817 540 , .
#Text=Auto Europe Portugal , 800 780 008 , .
#Text=Europcar , Praça General Barbosa 124 , tel . +351 813370 .
#Text=Auto Jardim , Rua Alves Cerqueira , 71 , ☏ +351258847301 . / 73 .
#Text=See
#Text=Basilica of Santa Luzia , on Mt . St. Luzia - Constructed in 1903 , it was inspired by the Sacré Coeur de Montmartre in Paris .
#Text=From the basilica 's location on top of Mount St. Luzia , there are spectacular views of the city and the beach .
#Text=The best view of the city can be seen from the pinnacle of the church , accessible from the church through an elevator or through the stairs .
#Text=You can reach the basilica either by car via the Santa Luzia highway , or by taking the Santa Luzia Elevator .
#Text=Gil Eanes Naval Museum , on the Dock - A floating naval hospital constructed in 1952 and which operated until 1973 .
#Text=It is now open to the public as a kind of museum , housing the original equipment .
#Text=The ship has operation rooms , communication equipments , refrigerating chambers and a reinforced hull .
#Text=It was restored by a group of locals .
#Text=It was then adapted to become a youth hostel and is one of the city 's biggest attractions .
#Text=Former City Hall , at the Praça da República ( Republic Square ) - Built in the 16th century , it is located in the Praça da República .
#Text=In the facade you can see the coat of arms of the city : a boat and an armillary sphere .
#Text=Sá Family House , at the Praça da República ( Republic Square ) - An ancient building , also in the Praça da República , with a beautiful facade .
#Text=It was projected by João Lopes , the same architect that projected the fountain in the middle of the square .
#Text=Each battlement of the facade has a human renaissance figure .
#Text=Fountain at Praça da República , at the Praça da República ( Republic Square ) - This granite fountain , richly adorned with carved figures , was built by João Lopes in the 16th century .
#Text=Monument to Caramuru and Paraguaçu at the Praça da República ( Republic Square ) , was built by Jose Rodrigues in 2009 .

#Text=Consistory of Misericórdia , at the Praça da República ( Republic Square ) - Situated at the Praça da República , the complex is constituted by the Misericórdia Hospital , with one of the most beautiful renaissance facades in the city , built by João Lopes , and by the Misericórdia Church , remodeled in the 18th century , with beautiful tiles inside .
#Text=Cathedral , on the Largo da Matriz - The cathedral is Gothic in style , with Galician influence , and has two large towers .
#Text=It has a very beautiful interior .
#Text=Fort of Santiago da Barra , on Campo do Castelo .

#Text=Consisting of an quadrangular outer wall with the Roqueta tower in the center , this fort was constructed during the reign of Dom Manuel I. The tower displays the coat of arms of the city , flanked by an armillary sphere and by the Order of Christ Cross .
#Text=Church of St. Domingos , Largo de São Domingos .
#Text=- The church of the old Santa Cruz convents , founded by Frei Bartolomeu dos Mártires .
#Text=Viana Municipal Museum , Largo de São Domingos .
#Text=Do

#Text=Beach - most beaches along the coast line have Blue Flag classification and start not more than a 10 minute drive from the city center , so make sure you take your time to enjoy one of the best things the region has to offer .
#Text=Hiking -
#Text=the foothills of Viana Do Castelo have some hiking paths .
#Text=You can get maps from the tourist information office .
#Text=Museums - Viana do Castelo is the capital of gold of Portugal .
#Text=You may visit a privately owned gold museum with some characteristic exhibits of the Minho area .
#Text=The most characteristic technique of working the gold in Viana do Castelo is filigree and you have excellent examples in exhibition there .
